info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 5:41PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Stonewall County through 615 PM CDT... At 540 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Old Glory, or 9 miles east of Aspermont, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Aspermont, Old Glory and Us-380 Near The Haskell- Stonewall County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
